etymology.description: 火(火) (huǒ, "fire") + 卩(卩) (jié, "kneeling person") = fire over a person's head -> emphasizing the shining of light
etymology.interpretation: The character 光(光) (guāng, "light") combines 火(火) (huǒ, "fire") with 卩(卩) (jié, "kneeling person") to illustrate fire positioned above a person’s head, highlighting the concept of light emanation.

examples.chinese: 太阳的光温暖大地(太陽的光溫暖大地)。
他脸上闪烁着光(他臉上閃爍著光)，给人希望(給人希望)。
examples.pinyin: Tā liǎn shàng shǎnshuò zhe guāng, gěi rén xīwàng。
examples.english: Light shimmers on his face, giving hope.
